tips: Property managers get 20+ vendor calls a week. Lead with the ROI — $10-20 net profit per unit monthly is the hook.
The best time to call property managers is Tuesday-Thursday, 10am-12pm. Mondays are hectic, Fridays they've checked out.
Every apartment complex you pass is a potential client. Save the name and address, look them up later.
Valet trash is the #1 most requested amenity by apartment residents. You're not selling a luxury — you're filling a gap.
Your first contract is the hardest. After that, you have a reference, a case study, and momentum.
Don't compete on price. Compete on reliability, professionalism, and the cleanliness of the dumpster area.
When a property manager says 'we already have a vendor' — ask when the contract expires. Plant the seed.
Track every call, every email, every visit. The data tells you what's working and what's not.
Garden-style apartments (2-3 story, spread out) are ideal starter properties. Easier routes, simpler logistics.
Your pickup truck is your most important asset right now. Keep it clean and branded — it's a moving billboard.
One property manager who likes you can refer you to their entire portfolio. Relationships compound.
Study your competitors' reviews. Their weaknesses are your selling points.
